Employment.title: Lead Data Scientist & Algorithm Engineer
Employment.desc: Lead Developer of predictive and prescriptive algorithms related to sleep and energy tracking; technical lead for data engineering function, developing systems and processes for managing critical business and user data.

Employment.title: VP of Data & Operations
Employment.desc: Maintainence and Development of Server Infrastructure for subscription based e-commerce / blogging website focused on Fantasy Sports analytics; Responsibilities include developing ETL pipelines for sports analytics data, maintaining website and data pipeline infrastructure, advanced analytics/modeling, and developing Shiny-based web applications.

Employment.title: Lead Data Scientist
Employment.desc: Manage a team of Data Scientists, who provide product analytics and develop BI solutions for both customers and internal stakeholders; direct Data Engineering efforts for enterprise Analytics infrastruture; Work closely with product organization to research and develop new data products.

Employment.title: Senior Data Scientist
Employment.desc: Technical lead for development and implementation of predictive models for call centers to optimize key performance metrics such as talk time, customer satisfaction, and sales rates using various Machine Learning techniques; Analysis of unstructured linguistic data using unsupervised learning and clustering techniques.

Employment.title: Data Analyst
Employment.desc: Responsibilities: A/B and multivariant testing; data management and reporting; development of statistical models for predicting customer behavior and monitoring key performance metrics on large and varied data; communication of statistical findings to marketing, business, and project management.

Employment.title: Visiting Assistant Professor
Employment.desc: Professor in Communication Sciences and Disorders at Northwestern University. Responsibilities included teaching undergraduate and graduate level college courses, serving on academic and departmental committees at the University.

Projects.Name: Daily-Fantasy Lineup Optimizer
Projects.Desc: R Package to generate optimal lineups for Daily-Fantasy Sports.
Projects.LongDesc: An R Package that generates optimal lineups for Daily-Fantasy Sports (DFS).  With a limited budget and estimated values for every player, the model uses greedy integer optimization to determine which set of players provides the highest predicted point outcome within the budget. The R package allows a person to go to one of several DFS sites, download player lists, customize the model in a number of ways, generate multiple lineups, and then export them in a format that is easily uploaded to the DFS site they chose.

Projects.Name: Adaptive Mixed Effects Modeling Package
Projects.Desc: Combining tree-based, boosted models with Linear Random-Effects
Projects.LongDesc: AMEM is an R package that combined non-parametric predictive modeling techniques (e.g., XGBoost), and the random-effects component of mixed effects models. It was inspired by this paper and this Python module.

Projects.Name: Voice Style Transfer with Tensorflow2
Projects.Desc: Python Module to convert one speaker's voice into another person's voice.
Projects.LongDesc: A Tensorflow2 implementation of AUTOVC: Zero-Shot Voice Style Transfer with Only Autoencoder Loss. Given the content of one speaker, and the voice-characteristics of another, the goal is to generate one speaker's words in another speaker's voice. The model uses an auto-encoder design to create a bottleneck that separates the content of speech from the language-independent characteristics of the speaker's voice.

Projects.Name: Scraping HealthCare.Gov
Projects.Desc: Python Module to scrape information from Healthcare.gov
Projects.LongDesc: A module built in native Python3 to hit the Healthcare.gov API, parse the output, and generate a standard set of documents including all glossary, blog, and article content from the Healthcare.gov website, in both English and Spanish.

Projects.Name: Pay Equity Analysis
Projects.LongDesc: As an external consultant, I performed a pay equity analysis for a small Chicago-based firm. Specially, the analysis was focused on determining whether there were pay equity issues among various demographic splits within the company.

Projects.Name: Scraping NHL Data
Projects.Desc: Provides tools for pulling NHL data from the NHL API and generating a Postgres Database.
Projects.LongDesc: An R package that provides tools for pulling data from the NHL API, including player-, game-, and shot-level information. Includes functionality for building or updating PostgreSQL database. Inspired by the nhlscrape package.

Projects.Name: Object-Oriented Programming in R
Projects.Desc: Talk given at Chicago R User Group
Projects.LongDesc: Talk presented at Chicago R User Group. In the talk, I compare and contrast the different Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) frameworks in R (S3, S4, R6), and discuss the ways in which each implements traditional OOP hallmarks like encapsulation and polymorphism.

Projects.Name: CLEARPOND: A tool for linguistic neighborhood densities
Projects.Desc: A Resource for Linguistic Neighborhood Density
Projects.LongDesc: The Cross-Linguistic Easy-Access Resource for Phonological and Orthographic Neighborhood Density (CLEARPOND) is a web-based tool that provides neighborhood information for words in and across five languages. It is typically used by linguistic researchers interested in cross-language lexical information, and when designing experimental stimuli.

Projects.Name: Portfolio Website
Projects.Desc: Website using JSX and SCSS/CSS, and bootstrapped with React.
Projects.LongDesc: The very website you're looking at right now! The site was built from scratch using JSX and SCSS/CSS, and was bootstrapped with React.  I wanted to build a website for myself in order to become more familiar with JS and SCSS, but to experiment with React as a web/app framework.
